intro: Trichosporum malindangense, commonly known as the Mindanao trichosporum, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
